title: Nuclear Power Plants in the CO River Basin
name: Nuclear Power Plants in the CO River Basin

properties.name: Blue Castle Nuclear Power Plant
properties.about: The proposed Blue Castle Nuclear Power Plant would take over 50,000 acre feet* of water out of the already strained Green River in Utah. This huge nuclear power plant would primarily export energy out of state to California, and not be used to meet the in-state energy needs of Utah citizens.Western Resource Advocates believes that this project is not appropriate for the arid climate of the West, and that the environmental impacts to Utahâ€™s Green River are too great. Already, the Green River is unable to meet the recommended water levels necessary to provide a healthy habitat to native endangered fish species like the Humpback Chub, the Bonytail, the Pipeminnow and the Razorback Sucker. Learn more about endangered fish that depend on a healthy Green River here: http://www.westernresourceadvocates.org/water/endangered.php Learn more about water for energy use here: http://www.westernresourceadvocates.org/water/waterenergy.php *Acre-Foot (AF): the volume of water required to cover one acre to a depth of one foot; the equivalent of 326,000 gallons and enough to satisfy the annual water needs of approximately 6-12 people. *Acre-Foot (AF): the volume of water required to cover one acre to a depth of one foot; the equivalent of 326,000 gallons and enough to satisfy the annual water needs of approximately 6-12 people.

properties.name: Palo Verde Nuclear Generating Station
properties.about: The Palo Verde Nuclear Generating Station is a nuclear power plant located in just West of Phoenix, Arizona. It is the largest nuclear generation facility in the United States and is operated by Arizona Public Service Co. The plant has been online since 1986. Learn more about this nuclear plant here: http://www.nrc.gov/info-finder/reactor/palo1.html
